document_data.mainbody:
afrad was a small town found along the banks of the mighty Nogaro River within the Cities of the Ancients region of east Zakhara in 1367 DR.
Mafrad was located inland approximately  due west of Rogosto along the coast of Bahr al-Ajami. The town sat at the end of a cleared trail that connected the Nogaro with an unnamed river to the east. The trail made travel through the jungles relatively easy.
